docs.snippet: No special movement has taken place to-day. The fortifications have already become very formidable, and it would require an immense force to take the position from the Federal forces.
docs.lead_paragraph: No special movement has taken place to-day. The fortifications have already become very formidable, and it would require an immense force to take the position from the Federal forces.

docs.snippet: The Arabia salled at 4 P.M. for Boston, where she will be due tomorrow evening. She has 150 passengers, but no specie.

headline.main: The Latest News by the Arabia.; COMMERCIAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Arabia salled at 4 P.M. for Boston, where she will be due tomorrow evening. She has 150 passengers, but no specie.

docs.snippet: At the meeting of the Common Council, last evening, Alderman STRONG read the following dispatch received by Brig.-Gen. CROOKE. It was loudly applauded by the Aldermen and lobby:
docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Common Council, last evening, Alderman STRONG read the following dispatch received by Brig.-Gen. CROOKE. It was loudly applauded by the Aldermen and lobby:

docs.snippet: Friends of Gov. HICKS, Senator GOLDSBOROUGH and the Secretary of State of Maryland, arrived this morning from Frederick, and have visited Gen. THOMAS' Brigade, and asked troops for Frederick. Gen. PATTERSON will immediately advance a Brigade to that...

headline.main: FROM WESTERN MARYLAND.; FIGHT IN PROGRESS AT WILLIAMSPORT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Friends of Gov. HICKS, Senator GOLDSBOROUGH and the Secretary of State of Maryland, arrived this morning from Frederick, and have visited Gen. THOMAS' Brigade, and asked troops for Frederick. Gen. PATTERSON will immediately advance a Brigade to that point, and it will march to-day.

docs.snippet: The three regiments of New-Jersey troops now stationed at Camp Olden are in excellent health and spirits, and will shortly proceed to the seat of war.

headline.main: NEW-JERSEY TROOPS AT CAMP OLDEN.; THE TROOPS IN GOOD HEALTH AND SPIRITS GOV. OLDEN INNOCENT OF THE CHARGES MADE AGAINST HIM THE THREE NEW-JERSEY REGIMENTS THEIR EQUIPMENTS, &C.

docs.lead_paragraph: The three regiments of New-Jersey troops now stationed at Camp Olden are in excellent health and spirits, and will shortly proceed to the seat of war.

headline.main: JUSTICE TO THE FIFTY-FIFTTH REGIMENT. To the Editor of the New-York Times:
